member.summary: Gets rank data by parsing the embedded ranklist xml.

member.returns: An array of Rank objects.

member.name: M:Xiperware.WiretapAPI.Data.GetCountryBorders
member.summary: Gets country border data by parsing embedded files of lat/long degree polygons.
member.remarks: Data provided by PSU's Digital Chart of the World Server based on NIMA's 'Vector Map Level 0' data. http://www.maproom.psu.edu/dcw/.
member.returns: A list of CountryBorder's.

member.name: T:Xiperware.WiretapAPI.Frontline
member.summary: A frontline between friendly territory and "no-mans-land".
member.remarks: Generating a pair of frontlines from a list of chokepoints is non-trivial and took several attempts and rewrites to come up with an algorithm that was sufficiently robust. The method used here expands a polygon to create a hull that contains all friendly towns, then creates a line along the hull edge where it is near the enemy.

member.summary: Create a new Frontline object (assign cps later).
member.param: The Side this frontline surrounds.

member.param: The Side this frontline surrounds.
A list of all ChokePoints to be used in calculating this frontline (normal and dummy CPs).

member.name: T:Xiperware.WiretapAPI.Misc.ClockSkew
member.summary: As some game events are generated when data changes (eg, AO's), their event time is based on the users local clock (DateTime.Now). Because most other events are based on the times sent from Wiretap, this introduces clock skew issues if the two are out of sync. We work around this by calculating an approximate offset, accurate to near 1 minute, and apply this to Wiretaps time to convert everything to the users view of the time. This is done based on the fact that, when polling for new captures every minute, any new capture times must have occurred in the past minute. We narrow this down over time to get the latest capture time in that 1 minute time window.

member.name: M:Xiperware.WiretapAPI.Misc.ClockSkew.Reset
member.summary: Reset internal data and start calculations again from the beginning.

member.name: M:Xiperware.WiretapAPI.Misc.ClockSkew.AddDataPoint(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Add a reference date/time data point to further refine the clock skew calculation.
member.param: A UTC timestamp from Wiretap that is known to be less than a minute old.
member.returns: True if clock skew has been updated.
